list_definition.definition: to pull with a violent movement

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He wrenched the gun out of her hand.
I wrenched my shoulder moving furniture about.

list_definition.definition: a type of strong tool for turning nuts, bolts etc.

list_ex_of_english: Wrench capabilities represent the maximum forces and moments that can be applied or sustained by the manipulator.
This means that any external wrench can be compensated by positive tensions in the wires, and so the positioning point belongs to the workspace.
One notices that each wrench component has a corresponding maximum value within specific and proper configurations.
The volume defined by either the ellipsoid or the polytope represents feasible twists or wrenches.
Such a state can be easily maintained, provided the imposed wrenches at the support foot, resulting from link motions, are summed up to zero.
The analysis showed that no more coupling relations exist between effort wrench components of the realistic torso during several walking gaits.
If the common line of the two passive joint planes passes through the spherical joint center of the third leg, this line intersects six wrenches.
The extent to which deafness limits well-being is uncertain (though of course the experience of losing one's hearing is a wrenching one).
